sentences.sContent: He wore spectacles perched on the very end of his nose.
The end of the pencil snapped.
sentences.sCn: 铅笔的笔尖啪的一声断了。

sentences.sContent: Jo joined the end of the line.
eg:the far end(= furthest from you ) of the room
The channel measures 20 feet from end to end.
...I beg you’re looking forward to the end of this month...
...Pam said we won't have the psychology test until the end of next week...
...people changed sleep patterns thanks to the start or end of daylight savings time...
...As she neared the end of her prison sentence...
...In the end Ned lost his leg...
...their child could end up one of those sad...
...such books, which only rarely end up in permanent collections...
...I hear you’ll be leaving at the end of this month...
...But chariots maintained their place in parades and triumphs right up until the end of the Roman Empire 1...
...What does the woman want to know at the end of the conversation...

synos.tran: 结束；目标；尽头；末端；死亡

phrases.pCn: 到……结束时；到……时为止；在……之前

words.tran: 无止境的；连续的；环状的；漫无目的的
直立着的；向前的；末端朝前或向上的（等于endways）
竖着；末端向前地；两端首尾相接；向着两端（等于endways）

trans.tranOther: the part of a place or object that is furthest from its beginning or centre
to finish what you are doing
